name: Cliffwatch
economy_niches: small-craft repair yards and pilotage fees
culture_adjustments: kinship organized around lookout-rotations rather than ship clans
rituals emphasize wind, fog and stone as sacred elements
harbor-law favors piloting rights and signal claims over cargo disputes
seasonal labor timed to cliff-bird cycles as well as monsoons
constraints: difficult overland access â€” high transport costs
heavy reliance on imported ritual reagents
notes: signal chains and lighthouses form informal communication network
pilotage guilds exercise strong local authority
favored staging point for short-coast trade and salvage operations
